intro: Rhus theesans, commonly known as the staghorn sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often used to make a reddish dye. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that develop into red, fuzzy fruits. Rhus theesans thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adaptable to various soil types. It is also notable for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
